metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15606 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Including trailing white space in HTTP header values in Nodejs 10, 12, and13 causes bypass of authorization based on header value comparisons

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode64 - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
nodejs - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1').
